title: World Health Organization and Persistent Organic P

content.question: According to the World Health Organization, persistent organic pollutants <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>POPs</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are found in nearly all tested organism tissues and environmental samples. Which characteristic of <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> accounts for their presence in living tissues and in environmental samples?

choices.label: <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are lipophilic, which means that they can be stored in fatty tissues for long periods of time.

<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are released in to the air, water, and land, which allows them to be transported and incorporated in multiple ways.

<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are synthetic chemicals, so only humans and urban environments are exposed to the pollutants.

<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are organic compounds, so they can biodegrade easily and move through various environments.

content.answer: <math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are released in to the air, water, and land, which allows them to be transported and incorporated in multiple ways.
